source: Indiana Department of Veterans Affairs, Indiana 211, HVAF of Indiana, Indiana Legal Services, Roudebush VA Medical Center

resources.name: Indiana 211
resources.description: Free, confidential information and referrals for community resources including housing, food, health, employment, legal aid, and veteran services

resources.name: Indiana Department of Veterans Affairs (IDVA)
resources.address: 308 W Washington Street, Room E-120, Indianapolis, IN 46204
resources.description: State agency providing veteran services including benefits, employment, property tax deductions, housing, and crisis support

resources.name: HVAF (Hoosier Veterans Assistance Foundation)
resources.description: Largest non-profit provider of comprehensive services for veterans in Indiana, providing housing for 150+ homeless veterans

resources.name: Roudebush VA Medical Center
resources.description: VA medical center providing comprehensive healthcare, temporary and permanent housing assistance, benefits, and employment support

resources.name: Indiana Legal Services - Veteran Housing Stability Project
resources.description: Legal aid organization creating the Veteran Housing Stability Project to prevent evictions and homelessness among veterans

resources.name: Indiana Department of Workforce Development - Veteran Employment Services
resources.description: Provides employment assistance for veterans through Disabled Veterans' Outreach Program and Local Veterans' Employment Representative Program

resources.name: Veteran Opportunity Partners
resources.description: Veteran-focused employment and job listing service

resources.name: Indiana Veterans Home
resources.description: State-operated facility providing residential and burial options for qualified veterans

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: Hamilton Center - Mental Health Services for Veterans
resources.description: Community mental health organization providing PTSD treatment, counseling, and substance abuse services for veterans

additional_resources.military_family_relief_fund: Up to $2,500 grants available to veteran families
additional_resources.va_home_loan: VA home loan information and assistance
additional_resources.excel_center: Tuition-free high school diploma for veterans
additional_resources.va_benefits: https://www.va.gov/ - Comprehensive VA benefits and healthcare

notes: Indiana has comprehensive veteran support through HVAF (150+ housed veterans) and state services. Call 211 for local resource referrals. County Veterans Service Officers available for benefits assistance. Indiana Legal Services serves all 92 counties.
